p: An extracellular matrix metalloproteinase inducer (CD147/EMMPRIN) is a transmembrane glycoprotein that belongs to the immunoglobulin superfamily [ 11]. CD147 is involved in tumor development, plasmodium invasion and virus infection [ [12], [13], [14]]. CD147 can interact with cyclophilins as a signaling receptor and mediate the signaling and chemotactic activities of extracellular CyPA [ 15, 16].
